intro: Poa kronokensis, commonly known as the Kåreland bluegrass, is a species of grass native to the Nordic region, particularly Sweden. It is characterized by its fine, tufted growth habit and a bluish-green coloration due to its high chlorophyll content. The plant typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and forest edges. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are small, compact flower clusters typical of the Poaceae family. Poa kronokensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native environment.
